div.p: S. D. The rumor of peace in France, and indeed a good one, is being confirmed more and more. This week, the syndics and senate of Geneva write about this matter to the most honorable senate of Zurich, today they send a messenger, and the Bernese announce the same; at eleven before noon, friends from Augsburg write the same, affirming that they have received this information by post from Antwerp. If, therefore, peace has been made, which I am beginning to believe, eternal thanks must be given to God, who has dispersed so many cruel and savage plots. May we be grateful to our God and live a holy life! I do not remember receiving those letters, perhaps due to a lapse in memory, about which you write. Various and many things are being announced at the same time, about which, when I have more certain information, I will write, that is, after the Easter holidays, when our Froschauer returns from Frankfurt, laden with letters from friends in the Palatinate, Hesse, Saxony, Prussia, England, Poland, etc.
In the meantime, farewell, my dearest brother. May the Lord bless you, grant you a good Passion Week, and a joyful Easter!
Greet the consuls, Gantner, Pontisella, etc. Most swiftly.
To the most honorable man, Mr. Tobias Egli, faithful minister of the church of Chur, my esteemed lord and dearest brother.
